justification: "Panel A of Figure 3 plots the model-implied probability of first recall… Because this is immediate free recall… This is the recency effect."
The text notes that "a noticeable number [of subjects] start at the beginning of the list (a primacy effect)," referring to the same probability-of-first-recall plot.
"Panel B of Figure 3 plots the lag CRPs… The peaks at lags ±1 characterize the temporal contiguity effect: subjects are more likely to make transitions to words that were encoded nearby in time."

"Panel A of Figure 4 compares the IRT distributions in the data and model. The data suggest a highly variable, right-skewed distribution," using the IRT distribution to capture variability in response times.
